column4: UPDATE 1-Vale obtains license to expand giant Amazon iron ore mine
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  July 3 Vale SA  the world's largest iron ore miner  received a license from Brazil's Environmental Protection Agency to build a $19.5 billion expansion to its giant Carajas iron ore mining project  CEO Murilo Ferreira said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-SEC alleges insider trading in Onyx ahead of Amgen offer
column5: July 3 The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has filed a lawsuit accusing unnamed defendants of insider trading in Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc call options before the drugmaker publicly rejected a takeover bid by larger rival Amgen Inc and put itself up for sale.

column5: NEW YORK  July 3 Trading in CME Group's  benchmark U.S. crude oil contract surpassed IntercontinentalExchange Inc's North Sea Brent in June for the first time in 15 months as the huge price difference between the two contracts collapsed.

column4: UPDATE 1-Zynga's new CEO to get pay package worth some $50 million
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  July 3 Don Mattrick  the head of Microsoft Corp's Xbox business who will replace Zynga Inc founder Mark Pincus as chief executive next week  will get a hefty  largely stock-based compensation package of about $50 million in coming years  the company said in a regulatory filing on Wednesday.

column4: Ryanair June passenger numbers rise 2 pct on year
column5: DUBLIN  July 3 Low-cost carrier Ryanair's  passenger traffic rose 2 percent in June from a year earlier to 7.96 million  while the average load factor was unchanged at 84 percent  it said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Entergy sees New York Indian Point 2 reactor back soon
column5: By Scott DiSavino     July 3 Entergy Corp said it expects the 1 006-megawatt (MW) Unit 2 reactor at the Indian Point nuclear power plant to return to service in the next couple of days  following a shutdown for work earlier on Wednesday.     Entergy spokesman Jim Steets told Reuters there was a problem with an instrument air line that caused the unit's main boiler feed pumps to shut down and the plant operators to shut the reactor.     The pumps are located on the non-nuclear side of

column4: Entergy sees New York Indian Point 2 nuclear reactor back soon
column5: July 3 Entergy Corp said Wednesday it expects the 1 006-megawatt (MW) Indian Point 2 reactor to return to service in the next couple of days following a shutdown for work earlier Wednesday.

column4: June Canada auto sales up 1 percent to 171 608 -Desrosiers
column5: July 3 Canadian auto sales in June rose 1.3 percent to 171 608 vehicles  industry consultant Desrosiers said on Wednesday.

column4: SEC ends probe of key witness against Goldman's Tourre
column5: NEW YORK The SEC has ended a probe of a central witness it intends to call at this month's fraud trial against former Goldman Sachs Group Inc vice president Fabrice Tourre for his role in a notorious 2007 debt instrument that hedge fund billionaire John Paulson successfully shorted.

column4: New York to hear public views on possible close of NRG coal plant
column5: July 3 Public hearings over the possible retirement of New York's 520-megawatt (MW) Dunkirk coal-fired electricity generation plant will be held on July 15 to address concerns about power reliability  state regulators said on Wednesday.

column4: Brazil oil output falls for 14th month in May
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  July 3 Brazil's oil and natural gas output fell in May for a 14th straight month compared with a year earlier as platform repairs at state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA  or Petrobras  cut production  oil regulator ANP said on Wednesday.

column5: LONDON Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS)  has commissioned a review of its lending to small businesses  responding to concerns of a shortage of finance in a sector seen as vital to Britain's economic revival.

column4: Watson names North as vice-captain for 2014 Ryder Cup
column5: United States captain Tom Watson has appointed twice former U.S. Open champion Andy North as a vice-captain for next year's Ryder Cup against holders Europe at Gleneagles in Scotland.

column4: FCC approves Sprint/Clearwire/SoftBank deal: sources
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. regulators on Wednesday collected the final vote to approve the merger of Sprint Nextel Corp  and SoftBank Corp   sources familiar with the situation said  clearing the last hurdle in the Japanese company's drawn-out battle to take control of the No. 3 U.S. wireless provider.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. FCC approves Sprint/Clearwire/SoftBank deal -sources

column4: U.S. FCC approves Sprint/Clearwire/SoftBank deal-sources
column5: WASHINGTON  July 3 The Federal Communications Commission on Wednesday approved the merger of Sprint Nextel Corp and SoftBank Corp  sources familiar with the situation said  clearing the very last hurdle in the Japanese company's drawn-out battle to take control of the No. 3 U.S. wireless provider.

column4: Big shareholder Crest ends battle with Sprint over Clearwire
column5: July 3 Crest Financial  which owns a big stake in Clearwire Corp  said on Wednesday it is backing Sprint Nextel Corp's purchase of the rest of Clearwire  ending a protracted and noisy fight over the wireless service provider.

column5: DETROIT  July 3 The solid red brick house on a block of similar homes in Northwest Detroit sounds like a steal at $3 728.

column4: Lingering tensions prompt Toyota to mull shifting focus in China
column5: BEIJING Toyota and its dealers are quietly maneuvering to allay risks from periodic eruptions of anti-Japan sentiment in China  even as recent sales data suggest a slow but steady recovery for Japanese automakers since the latest flare-up last year.

column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. steel pipe makers defend energy business with trade case
column5: July 3 A group of U.S. companies that produce specialty steel pipe used to drill for oil and gas have launched one of the biggest steel trade cases in years  asking the U.S. International Trade Commission to stem what they say is a flood of unfairly traded products from nine countries.

column4: WikiLeaks claims victory as credit card donations flow again
column5: STOCKHOLM International credit card donations to WikiLeaks are flowing again after an Icelandic court ruling forced MasterCard's and Visa's local agent to process payments  the anti-secrecy organization said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Disney's 'Lone Ranger' starts box office ride with $2 mln
column5: LOS ANGELES  July 3 Walt Disney Co's  big-budget Western "The Lone Ranger " starring Johnny Depp as Native American sidekick Tonto  rode off with $2 million in U.S. and Canadian ticket sales during its first shows on Tuesday night  trotting well behind animated "Despicable Me 2."

column4: Disney's 'Lone Ranger' starts box office ride with $2 mln Tuesday
column5: LOS ANGELES  July 3 Walt Disney Co's  big-budget Western reboot "The Lone Ranger" rode off with $2 million in U.S. and Canadian ticket sales during its first shows on Tuesday night  trotting behind animated "Despicable Me 2" with $4.7 million  according to studio estimates.
